name: Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes

reviews.text: I stayed at this property during a four day busienss meeting. Although the lcoation is a bit off the tourist map, it is a fantastic hotel with first class amenities. The fact that it shares facilites with the JW Marriott is even better. Ritz guesrts can use the lazy river pool next door. The staff was very attentive and the room was very clean and luxurious. We had a group rate that was crazy low and I would stay at this hotel during the off or shoulder seson without any concern over cost.
reviews.title: Great Property Off the Beaten Path

reviews.text: I will begin with the downside, Hotel is isolated, 25 minutes drive to theme parks and shopping malls. This is a minor problem( no problem at all if you are here for golf!) as the Hotel itself is magnificent. My husband and myself travel extensively throughout the world and I believe the staff here are the most helpful, courteous, and well trained I have ever had the pleasure to experience. Special note should be given to the house keepers I had the pleasure to meet several of them as I was in my room when they came to turn down. They were so friendly, cheerful and eager to please and gave me extra chocolates Thanks!
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: I stayed here recently with my wife for a conference for two days.
reviews.title: It made visiting Orlando enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.text: The staff was outstanding. The food at the Lobby Bar (3 meals) and Poolside (1 meal) were top notch and not too pricey.
reviews.title: Very nice property......

reviews.text: Stayed there for 4 nights in Dec 12. It's a huge hotel with all modern amenities. There was a car show going on in the hotel complex at that time, a lifetime experience to see the best cars of the world showcasing their beauty and power. The stuffs at the hotel are freindly and very helpful. Good food option, including Indian food in one of the hotel restaurent. I tried the gym and the swiming pool, both are best in class. The holet is surrounded by a beautiful lake.
reviews.title: What a place to stay!

reviews.text: We reserved the ritz for three nights and ended up staying 8 over the holidays. We arrived on Christmas Eve and were immediately in awe of the gorgeous lobby decorated elegantly for the holiday season. The flowers near check in looked like candy canes. There was also a life sized gingerbread house in the lobby as well as a few grand Christmas trees and lights around the lobby. The rooms were very comfortable and decorated smartly. The grounds on the property were shared with the adjacent JW Marriott which shared restaurants to dine at. The spa was lovely and golf course was top notch with a nice restaurant and bar. The pool was never overcrowded and beautiful as well. Room Service breakfast was delicious in the morning and servers friendly and professional. All hotel staff that we came in contact with we're wonderful. I can go on and on about this resort. For kids they had around the clock activities kids camps & parties going on. The highlights fir the kids and big kids like myself were was the visit from Santa on christmas eve to our room and the gingerbread house making class for the whole family. The grand finale was on New Years Eve the resort had its very own spectacular firework show which we watched from our balcony. This Ritz property Will not disappoint even the most discerning of tastes. I wish we never left!
reviews.title: Holiday wonderland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 1/12-1/15/2013. Incredible hotel, immaculately furnished, the room was cozy but bigger than average, beautiful bathroom and balcony view of downtown. We stayed on the club level and had access to the lounge for breakfasts, snacks and drinks. The staff was always cheery and attentive from entering or leaving to bringing towels at the pool. We also had massges at the Spa, which is a three floor paradise. They were great! And even a birthday surprise for one of us there to celebrate that, too. would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel perfect for pampering and relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Ritz was outstanding. We had a nice room overlooking the pool and golf course. The room was
reviews.title: Love the Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well appointed. The bathroom had double sinks and was decorated in marble. The staff was very professional and friendly. I had a hot stone massage at the spa. It was incredible. Natalie was my massage therapist and she was excellent. The spa was so relaxing and beautiful. Could have spent the whole day there. The rooms have balconies so you can sit and enjoy the experience. We love this hotel and would definitely come back. My only complaint is that they charge for wi-fi.
reviews.title: New Year's Eve Gala

reviews.text: The staff was lacking the Ritz service we are used to. It is a beautiful building and our meals were good. The cake we had was AWESOME!! That cake was worth its weight in gold, lol. The balcony was nice and the pool was very pretty, very Floridian. The bathroom, living room and bedroom were spacious and clean, no complaints with the rooms or structure. The check-in and check out staff were just missing that classy and happy to help attitude that we are spoiled by at the Ritz, at other locations.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but...
The best hotel you can ever stay in
reviews.text: Great location with nice staff . I visited this place during my honeymoon , it was the beat place to stay in !! Great location with nice staff . The price was good too . The only thing is they charge you for your car parking and they also charge for your internet usage which i think they should be complementary .

As you would expect, the Ritz-Carlton Grande Lakes is first class all the way. Everything -- the public spaces, the guest rooms, and the service -- is first rate. The hotel is immaculate, the rooms luxurious and comfortable, and the atmosphere serene and peaceful. You will quickly forget you are in Orlando. The hotel is connected by a short causeway to a JW Marriott which shares the manicured, golf course setting with the Ritz-Carlton. Both valet and self-parking (in a surface lot) are available. I tend to prefer self-parking, but be aware that the self-parking lot is a fairly long walk from the hotel, which depending on the weather in Orlando will seem even longer. This is one hotel where valet parking is worth the extra price.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: I was attending a conference at the adjacent JW Marriott, and was placed in the Ritz when the Marriott was fully booked. It is a lovely hotel, with beautiful public spaces, excellent service. My room was clean and spacious. The decoration is luxurious without being over the top. I ate in the lobby lounge one night and the food was delicious, and quickly presented by a gracious and attentive server. However, a Ritz should feel like a Ritz in all respects, since my company was certainly paying Ritz prices! If I had been paying for the room myself, I would have been taken aback by the following: (1) There was a huge stain on one of the bedspreads. Yuck! (2) The cushions and table on the balcony were covered with bird poop. When I turned the cushions over - more bird poop. The night I arrived, I spent some time sitting in the lovely night air. The next morning, I took a look at the balcony and observed with dismay what I had been sitting in. (3) Very few HD television channels. This is always annoying when an HDTV is provided, with the stretched, pixellated picture that results. In a Motel 6, I accept it. In the Ritz, I expect more. (4) The internet service was terrible. If I had been paying the $13/day, I would have been irate, and I did contact my company's event planners to suggest they ask for a refund. I was expected to hurry back to my room at breaks and in the evening to catch up with work. The wifi signal was weak (on my laptop - my phone couldn't even find it), VERY slow, and dropped very frequently. Much of the time it was down more than it was up. One morning at 10 AM, it worked pretty well, so apparently the problem was that the bandwidth wasn't up to it. (There was also an ethernet cable and jack in the room, but they didn't function.) I had a conversation with the hotel manager about it, who apologized and acknowledged that he was aware of the problem. I don't know whether that's good or bad - they admit they have a problem but haven't fixed it. If you're going to host giant conferences, you should be able to accommodate the needs of those attending the conference. I turned off my laptop and watched the World Series, so no great loss for me - but my company did NOT get its money's worth. As I told the hotel manager, if a Budget 8 motel can include free wifi service that is dependable and strong, then there can only be two reasons for the Ritz to CHARGE for it: either it is because they can get away with charging for it, or because they are providing a premium service. Let me tell you - the service was not premium.
reviews.title: Little things kept it from being excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here a few weeks ago and just DID NOT have the experience we expected. For me, Ritz-Carlton (owned by Marriott) becomes more and more like staying at a Marriott every time I stay at one. The staff seemed to be "put out" every time we asked for something. The room was not as promised (amenities were not there) when we arrived. The concierge was less than responsive and slow to act.
reviews.title: you might as well stay at Marriott

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a conference and to visit SeaWorld and Disney. As a conference hotel, it gets a five plus rating as a family hotel I would give it a three/four. Unlike the prior poster, my son and nephew were not made to feel like princes. When I mentioned would they like to check in or ask the gentleman any questions, the front desk clerk stared at me as if I was crazy. We were literally standing in front of the little checkin desk for kids, but the front desk clerk did not encourage the boys to use it. Maybe they treat you differently if you are checking in for a conference.
reviews.title: Mixing Business and Pleasure

reviews.text: I took the kids to the pool the first afternoon. The pool attendant at the Marriott could not have been any nicer if he tried. He answered lots of questions, found me a shady place to sit, gave me advice about the resort , and even offered to go get me towels and brought me extras. When we went back to the ritz, the service was lousy. It took me ten minutes to find someone I could ask about an umbrella. She pointed me across the pool, and told me that she was going to go collect the dirty towels and that then I could sit there. I was flabbergasted and told her no that I wanted to sit near the kids. She condescended to open an umbrella for me, but never offered to lay out the nice towels the ritz offered. On a positive note, there are mats available to use in the pool.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: Our room had a great view and the beds were very comfortable. The closet and bathroom was disappointing as it was set up for handicap access and the water in the shower was never hot enough. The conference facilities were excellent. Valet Parking had great service and they always asked if I needed directions. I loved being offered a bottle of water on my way out and in.
reviews.title: Grande Luxe near Disney (but not too near)

reviews.text: The Ritz is very close to SeaWorld and even offers a shuttle. We drove as we wanted to be there when the park opened. I wouldn't stay here if my destination was Disney. I find the Grand Floridian, Yacht Club, and Hyatt Grand Cypress to all be nicer hotels than the Ritz Orlando with much easier access to Disney.
reviews.title: An upscale hotel and amazing service in Orlando!

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel at the end of May. I cannot praise the staff and the hotel enough. We traveled with our 4 year old daughter who was treat like a princess, given her own bracelet for free ice cream throughout her stay and her own Ritz Robe and slippers. The pool area and bar were fantastic and Breakfast was superb. Disney was a 10 min drive away and it was great to have the contrast from the hustle. The joining Marriott has a great lazy river for children. We will be back. The only downside is this hotel has spoiled us for future holidays!
reviews.title: Luxurious and Family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel with a fabulous spa. The staff here is always very professional. The massages are wonderful. The food at the vitale spa cafe is so good. Truly a nice way to spend the day. You do not have to be a hotel guest to visit the spa. And you can also purchase a day spa pass if you would just like to use the pool, the sauna, the hottub and have lunch. You don't have to have any spa treatments to purchase a day pass. A truly special way to pamper yourself.
reviews.title: The spa is my happy place

reviews.text: I loved this hotel. I got a room overlooking the pool and the golf course. Champagne upon checkin, good food, friendly staff.... I could get use to this. The pool area was quiet and employees were so attentive I almost felt uncomfortable. (almost) I also got a facial at the spa there and it was hands down the best facial I have ever had. The woman to did the facial looked about 20 years younger than she was, so I bought every item she recommended. Our group used the bocce ball courts there and stayed up until 2am playing and socializing every night. Very fun.
reviews.title: Felt like a vacation, but it was a work trip

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Spa a little overrated. Security glitch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No doubt, a huge and beautiful complex. Excellent food and the hotel is spotless. I was really disappointed about security. When I arrived, I immediately went to my beautiful room and dropped off my luggage and went to explore. A co-worker was in a room nearby and phoned me to alert me that a hotel employee was knocking on my door and entered. I phoned the front desk and no one knew anything about it. An hour or so later, another co-worker called me to say that my room door was propped open. My co-worker closed the door and notified me. I phoned the front desk and again and still no one knew anything. After going down to the front desk, I was told that there was a "security issue" and that they needed to move me to a new room...strange... Very poor attention to the security of my belongings.
reviews.title: Heavenly!

reviews.text: The spa is a great retreat but I felt that it was overrated by some of the reviewers here. I have been to better spas for far less money. In the dressing room/bathroom area I slipped slightly (no damage) on the tile floor in the 'slip proof" shoes they provided so I reported the slippery floor so no one would fall. When I arrived back from my treatments, I was chatting with a woman who had actually slipped on the same spot. I think my report was ignored. They have "happy hour" prices but be aware that if you choose their pricey packages, the discount does not apply. The check out lady was borderline rude when she was explaining this to me. Very curt.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, top-notch service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton Grande lakes hotel is gorgeous and their spa is huge. There is no better way to treat or pamper yourself. The food at the Vitale spa cafe is some of the best food I have ever eaten. They make a fabulous blue crab salad and the ahi tuna is to die for. Everything on the menu is fabulous. The staff really goes out of their way to make you happy. If you want something that isn't on the menu just ask. The waitresses out by the pool are hardworking and very pleasant. I visit this place a few times a year and the staff always remembers me and I feel like they are family. I get incredible massages from my favorite therapist and if I tell you his name I will probably never get an appointment with him again. He is very professional and I feel like a million bucks after my treatment. I would move in here if I could. It is just that great. If you are ever in the area treat yourself to a spa treatment and spend the day at the pool and have lunch at vitale. You deserve it and you will be glad you did.
reviews.title: Treat yourself and go to the spa

reviews.text: Great hotel, great service, great hospitality,and great people. They deliver what the Ritz advertises and promises. Highly recommend, you will not be disappointed. Go and enjoy a cocktail and appetizer at the Lobby Bar, first class people, service and ambiance.
reviews.title: Everything you would expect from a Ritz.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, lovley setting and top marks for customer service. One of the few hotels that I cannot fault one bit. Perfect place to stay if you plan on going to any of the parks as they have free shuttles in the morning and back in the evening. Food was awsome too, dont be afraid to try the Marriot next door too, their restuarants were perfect too and a little cheaper.
reviews.title: Everything perfect about this place!

reviews.text: Before my trip to Orlando, in january 2013, I made an extensive research looking for a hotel that is no a tipical Disney hotel. I was spending all day with a lot of kuds, so I need a more grow up place. I saw some pictures of Ritz-Carlton, and with the brand name plus special price, it was my choice. Oh My God! My stay was perfect. The reception with a glass of champagne, the cordiality of the valet and all the staff, the amenities inside my bathroom, and also the size of the same bathroom. Everything was great! Everyday, the valet asked ne if I need directions, and if I need some water. This is a 5 star service my friend. I also bought some stuff from Amazon and everything was delivered to my room in no time. Well, defenitly I will be back at Ritz-Carlton Orlando. One of the best Hotels I had the opportunity to know.
reviews.title: The best!

reviews.text: After a few minor glitches, the staff at the Ritz was top notch! Every employee we encountered was personable, helpful, and extremely pleasant! We were always treated with such kindness and hospitality!
reviews.title: Wish there was a 10 star rating!

reviews.text: From the time you drive up you know the Ritz Carlton Orlando Grand Lakes is dedicated to providing the best hotel experience available. Front dest and management are tops in the industry. The fooms are fresh and spotlessly clean. Face north looking at the pool for a great view plus see the fireworks each night of the different parks. Spa and gym are outstanding. Do not miss the buffet breakfast. While a little pricy it is well worth it.
reviews.title: Special in every way

reviews.text: Simply put, this hotel goes the extra mile to assure your stay is exceptional.
reviews.title: Best In Orlando

reviews.text: Have stayed in several "luxury" Orlando hotels and this is by far the nicest. Great location, very clean and friendly service. The Hotel is Very close to Convention Center and easy drive to local attractions. Hotel has very nice relaxing pool area.
reviews.title: It doesn't get any better than a Ritz...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Concierge was very helpful with helping us find locally owned breakfast restaurant options off site.
reviews.title: Definately worth the splurge!
How grand is the Ritz Carlton!
reviews.text: The Valet did not seem to be on duty in the early mornings when we returned from nightlife which would have made the valet parking fee worthless if we hadn't just left the car at the entrance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Central located near Disney World and International drive this hotel is a perfect place to stay in Orlando.
reviews.title: Excellent property, excellent service

reviews.text: The property is really beautiful with a golf course and very beautiful lakes.
reviews.title: Unbelievable value for the outstanding service

reviews.text: The staff is very nice and attentive and many know your name, from the front desk to the restaurants.
reviews.title: Superlative Service--Really Above and Beyond

reviews.text: The rooms are well decorated and have a balcony, many of them with lake view.Bathrooms are spacious with separate shower and with all necessary toiletries. Turn down service is impecable.
reviews.title: So Much Fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also provide complimentary shoe shine.
reviews.title: Simply the best Ritz Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When visiting Orlando I always eat at the spa cafe 2-3 times. The food is some of the best I have ever eaten. You do not have to be a guest of the hotel to eat here. The service is excellent and the food is wonderful. The famous blue crab salad is a favorite. It is out of this world. Ahi tuna also great as is the shrimp. This place never disappoints.
reviews.title: The food at Vitale Spa Cafe is the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay! If you are staying at this location make sure to check out the lazy river locate at the adjacent family hotel; JW Marriot. The food it's amazing, and the people are super friendly. This is a pet friendly resort..
reviews.title: Gorgeous place

reviews.text: The Spa is fantastic. What makes it special is not just the facilities, it is the quality of the services and the friendliness of the people.
reviews.title: They make you feel like if you are their most important guest

reviews.text: The massage therapist was excellent. She gave me a very relaxing massage. Exactly what I needed. Her name is Andrea Ulloa. I would definitely ask for her on my next visit.
reviews.title: Very clean with inconsistent service

reviews.text: The esthetician was outstanding too. I was going to have a signature facial but she recommended the Anti-Aging one and I don't regret paying extra for it. My face felt a lot better after the 50 minute facial. Her name is Deborah Buffa and she is very knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Service is paramount

reviews.text: This was a nice treat in Orlando. The service was great and always went out of their way. They have a beautiful pool - great for kids. The food for room service was ok. It was good but I expected more from the Ritz. We ordered pizza one night and it was basically frozen pizza that they added toppings on. Also the beds were harder than we liked. Overall we would go back. It was a great location to Sea World and Disney. And the Spa was excellent!
reviews.title: Love the hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have never stayed at a Ritz property, you must try this one. Our first visit was when my wife and I celebrated our 10th anniversary here. During the process of the reservation, I was asked if this was business or pleasure and told them we were celebrating our anniversary. When we got to our room, there was a gift basket waiting for us to welcome us as new Ritz guests, as well as a platinum picture frame celebrating our anniversary. On future visits, we always had something waiting for us in our room. The last visit I was provided with gift certificates to the spa!
reviews.title: Never disappointing!
Love!
reviews.text: When you pull up to this place, as you enter the front entrance of the hotel, the valets are already walking up to your car. They open your doors for you, take your luggage, even open the front door of the hotel lobby. When you go to the registration desk to check in, first thing they ask is if you would like some champagne or chilled water while you are waiting. AMAZING! Staff is very friendly, extremely personable and helpful.

The Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes does it right! The word "no" does not exist there and no attention to entail is left unturned. The spa and the Vitale Cafe were excellent. The pools were relaxing and beautiful. We took advantage of the JW Marriott pool, lazy river as well. Very nice. The sushi bar at JW Marriott is worth the walk and so is the new sandwich(breakfast & lunch) shop, Bodega. Nice addition. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. Just a great visit. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Top Of The Line - Best of the Best!

reviews.text: I recently spent 3 nights at this hotel and can only rave about how nice everything is. The staff is world class...from the check-in, cleaning staff, bartenders, pool people, everyone was friendly, nice and went out of their way to make your experience at their hotel the best! My room was large and had a great view of the pool and the golf course. The pool area was clean and the water warm and inviting. The food was great. I loved my time here.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our first anniversary. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in!! Service was exceptional- everything you could expect for the Ritz. I loved the Victorian-style furnishings (rivals Disney's Grand Floridian resort, which is the utmost in luxury!) and the bathroom was incredible with separate marble shower and tub. The only draw-back is the location is not desirable to Orlando attractions.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL! Beautiful and romantic- will stay here again

reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful and they made our first anniversary one to remember!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in.

reviews.text: After much debate with my husband we decided to go to the USA for a holiday instead of Jumeriah Beach in Dubai. I am so glad we did. We stayed between the 10th and 17th of May 2009. It is a hotel which is about 15 minutes drive from the Disney Parks. What a fantastic hotel! The hotel is very beautiful and opulent. It has ample staff working there, 4 people to open the door for us and wish us a good day when leaving and entering! We had a hire car and used their valet parking facility $20 for the day plus tips. They were very friendly and always asked if we needed directions. Always gave bottles of water and helped with the luggage. You can be cheeky and just park in the Marriott car park but we didn't.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Stay for a Family
The Best Hotel/Resort in Orlando!!!
reviews.text: The rooms are really nice and big. Separate shower from the bath which is a nice touch. Tea and coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board. The rollaway bed was $15 a night and well worth it as we needed a good night sleep after the parks. The balcony was lovely as was the pool view. I didn't let the kids on the balcony on their own and I didn't think it was too safe (4 and 1 year old).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was a buffet for $50 a day 2 adults including children (kids eat free). Alot of variety and it was very tasty. My daughter couldn't get enough pancakes and maple syrup! If you can sit outside for breakfast it had such a nice view and not many people out there.
reviews.title: A luxurious overnight
Time for an update
reviews.text: I have stayed there at least 20 times and this is the first time I thought it was showing its age. Rooms are old, bathrooms looked dirty. The concierge floor which you pay a premium for was a waste of money. The food was not good the staff was lazy and the coffee was cold every day their. Day old newspapers and no turn down without asking. You pay a lot but they r letting it go. Too bad. The four seasons Orlando opens soon. Ritz is in big trouble

reviews.title: Awesome Spa Experience
reviews.text: My daughter-in-law and I scheduled 40 minute Ashiatsu massages. This is the massage in which the therapist performs the massage with their feet. There is a support beam in the ceiling of the room that supports the therapist so that the can adjust the strength of the massage. But since I love a deep tissue massage, this massage delivers. You lie on your stomach and these therapists massage you with their heels and toes as if they were fingers.

reviews.title: The Ritz at its best
reviews.text: If you go allow plenty of time to relax afterward. We hung out in the steam room, hot tub, had lunch and then relaxed by the outside pool. We spent the day and it was well worth it. Planning on coming back with my daughter and daughter-in-law soon.

reviews.title: Great Place To Stay
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our two night stay here! Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, the entire place is spotless, and room service food quality was outstanding. The Indian food items were particularly tasty! The only minor irritant was the phone system in our suite, which seemed to work inconsistently.

My husband and I and our two kids stayed here a few summers ago. We got a special rate on-line. The rooms were very nice. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was included. It included a buffet. Pool was very nice. We were able to use the JW Marriot pool next door. They have a lazy river. Very close to Disney attraction, Sea World. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Quality Delivered
luxury!!
reviews.text: This is a very comfortable luxury hotel for a stay in Orlando. Great service from all the staff and free shuttles to all Disney attractions. Will definitely use again on our next stay. restaurants were of a high standard and the pool service was great as were the snacks available there.

You expect to pay alot at a Ritz, but you also expect alot for that price. There is a cost to access the pool. The Spa prices are also more than a deluxe spa in NYC. The rooms are very big though. Comortable beds and BIG bathrooms. I would expect complimentary shuttles to go shopping but that wasn't the case. Taxi charged me $35 to go to the outlets and $35 to return. I've stayed at nicer Ritz' for slightly less. I guess if money is no option this is a good location.
reviews.title: BIG rooms, BIG price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a couple of days twice, to "recover" before a more hectic holiday.
reviews.title: Ritz v Waldorf

reviews.text: Rooms: comfortable, big arm chair, nice balcony, pale blue decor (much nicer than the normal beige), big bathroom, easy layout so most rooms in close proximity
reviews.title: Not up to Ritz-Carlton standards

reviews.text: Dining: beuatiful bar just of lobby with good finger food, cocktails and people watching. Service sometimes a little slow. Eat at Norman's - OK, slightly overly attentive service, and menu not hugely inspiring, and lumps in the mash. Breakfast undoubtably the star of the show, beautiful display, everything you could want, including good fruit and juice sections, no wait, and relativly clam even on holiday days.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.text: I have never stayed at a Ritz but have always wanted to stay in one and I can see now why the hotel is raved. It is fabulous. The main lobby is mesmerizing and our room was gorgeous. The bathroom, I must say, was my favorite. It was clean and very roomy. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this fabulous hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worst hotel we stayed, service motel 6 level, food bellow average, very disappointing for a Ritz Carlton, we stayed at the Ritz in Tyson Corner, in NY, no comparison.
reviews.title: motel 6 service

reviews.text: This was our first Disney vacation trip, and we stayed off Disney resort hotels. We are so glad we did that. Staff was attentive, kind and concern about every one's well being and needs. The Hotel is a resort. Many activities for he kids as well as adults. Loved every minute of it. Will be back for sure.
reviews.title: Perfect 3-days

reviews.text: My first stay at a Ritz and the service completely lived up to any expectations. I am a pretty independent traveler and I was actually not used to such a level of assistance for my every whim.
reviews.title: Wonderful service, beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Vineyard Grill was very nice. Excellent food and service- although it should be for the price and al a carte menu. The other clientele was generally a subdued crowd, business, older folks, etc.
reviews.title: Very, very nice place for everything!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here during a very busy time---spring break/week leading up to Easter. We were upgraded from the JW Marriott and were quite thrilled that our room was exactly what we requested at check-in---golf course/pool view on an upper floor. The rooms are well appointed and staff overall is very attentive. Loved the quiet elegance of the pool area. Only negative was that I had to leave the outdoor cafe because I could not get waited on. This was made up by the courteous and speedy service I received in the lobby/bar area. I do get peeved that there is a daily charge for internet service ($9.95) and feel that a hotel of the Ritz's stature should comp this. I hear complaints all the time from fellow travelers about this---lesser hotels do not charge. The hotel is not far from Sea World and Universal and we were able to get around quite easily to Millenia Mall (absolutely beautiful) and restaurant row. Fitness Ctr was awesome---best I've been at in a hotel setting.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel in a tranquil locale

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I decided to stay at the Ritz even though they live in Orlando because I was visiting from California and "they wanted me to come back." They chose well by bringing me to the Ritz. The service was excellent and the spa was fantastic. Don't miss the spa- you can check in early to enjoy the pool, gym, steam room, etc and make a day out of it. We worked out, enjoyed bloody marys by the pool, received our services and then recapped by the pool. The spa cafe is also great (I recommend the Bento Box). The property was beautiful and far exceeded my expectations of Orlando (I was half expecting to be greeted by Mickey Mouse when I checked in). I am headed back to Orlando next month for a conference and I switched my hotels after staying here and am looking forward to my next trip.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Our family had a relatively short - 1 week vacation and wanted a good accommodations with quality. Our stay at the Ritz Carlton met and exceeded our expectations. From the minute we arrived the staff were outstanding in their attention to detail. They greeted us regularly by name and were accommodating at every turn. They could not enough for us. Despite being a high end hotel, they were extremely welcoming to families. The rooms were beautifully appointed. We have three children (8-11) and had adjoining rooms which I highly recommend. The hotel was neat, clean and luxurious as in Ritz Carlton style. The pool area was relaxing with beautiful scenery. The amenities such as the spa and fitness center - fabulous. The lighted pathway to The JW Marriott - the adjoining hotel is lovely. The "Lazy River" pool at the Marriott was great - (JW Marriott owns The Ritz Carlton). At The Ritz, we ate at "Bleu" - the pool side restaurant, The Lobby restaurant and The Vineyard Grill. Each had good choices on the menu and required "resort casual" attire which worked well for families. We did not eat at Norman's but the reviews are excellent. The children's menu had good healthy choices for the main course and sides which allowed several combinations with good portion size. You require a car to do any travel to the theme parks and the hotel requires valet service which costs $20/day +tips. This might be a turn off, but it is actually quite nice and is really what you would expect at a hotel of this quality.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Overall, this was a great vacation and after a busy day at the theme parks or shopping, it was so nice to come back to a serene, beautiful environment to relax and wind down. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next vacation to Orlando.
reviews.title: Great Choice in Orlando!

reviews.text: We have stayed here with our children several times and have always been pleased.
reviews.title: A top rate hotel in every way

reviews.text: The property itself is beautiful. Wonderful grounds, great walking trail. Landscaping is fantastic.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.text: I didn't use the Ritz pool. I used the JW Marriott next door (which you can for free). They have a lazy river at the JW Marriott, and the entire pool area at the Marriott is way bigger and nicer....especially is you have kids.
reviews.title: Great Hotel... but not five stars...

reviews.text: The room is smallish but nicely furnished. Very clean. Large wonderful bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was mostly good. The valet service is very slow. They did a really poor job for a 5 star resort.
reviews.title: The best by far in Orlando! You must stay on the CLUB FLOOR!!!

reviews.text: Free ice cream hunt for the kids. Nice touch
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

description: This brand new hotel is located 10 miles from Walt Disney World; 10 miles from Airport & 7 miles from Universal Orlando.
